[SYNTAX]: A few very long, complex sentences (e.g., the paragraph describing the dog breed debate) require careful parsing.

[STRUCTURE]: Minor meandering in descriptive asides (e.g., the butcher shop interaction) briefly slows narrative focus.

[LEXICON]: Occasionally archaic or overly formal vocabulary ("discomfited", "venomous snap") may cause minor readability pauses for modern readers.
[SYNTAX]: Infrequent use of comma splices in descriptive phrases (e.g., "exhausted and discomfited, we drifted away").

[CLARITY]: Sudden introduction of "What is that?" without immediate setup for the revealed stimulus.
